H0.text: Mitochondria are the membranous organelles in a cell that sequence enzymes and electron molecules for efficient cellular respiration.

H1.text: Glucose is the substance that the question identifies as a membranous organelle in a cell that sequences enzyme and electron molecules for efficient cellular respiration.

H2.text: Protons are the membranous organelles in a cell that sequence enzyme and electron molecules for efficient cellular respiration.

H3.text: Bacterial are the membranous organelles in a cell that sequence enzyme and electron molecules for efficient cellular respiration.

A4.text: Mitochondria have a double membrane structure and use aerobic respiration to generate adenosine triphosphate (ATP), which is used throughout the cell as a source of chemical energy.

A5.text: Eugene Kennedy and Albert Lehninger discovered in 1948 that mitochondria are the site of oxidative phosphorylation in eukaryotes.
